Draft Rating:

D

Billy McKinney ranks in the 27th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. McKinney's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 7 spots lower than they were picked due to their terrible drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Gary Leonard with 34th pick but was worth 17th pick.
  • Drafted Allan Houston with 11th pick but was worth 8th pick.
  • Drafted Grant Hill with 3th pick but was worth 2th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Felton Spencer with 6th pick but was worth 51th pick.
  • Drafted Doug West with 38th pick but was worth 48th pick.
  • Drafted Lindsey Hunter with 10th pick but was worth 32th pick.

Trade Rating:

F

Billy McKinney ranks in the 7th percentile for trading among executives in our database.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Pete Chilcutt, Cal Bowdler to DET.
  • Lost Olden Polynice to SAC.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Randy Breuer, Chris Smith to MIN.
  • Lost Brad Lohaus, Duane Cooper to MIL.

Signing Rating:

F

Billy McKinney ranks in the 12th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:
  • Signed Tracy Moore in 1993.
  • Signed Oliver Miller in 1994.
Their worst signings:
  • Signed Sam Mitchell in 1989.
  • Signed Rafael Addison in 1994.
  • Signed Tod Murphy in 1989.
